author: Special Correspondent
text:
Why Chief Minister is so helpless and silent on all this, asks Paswan

With the killing of a police official and firing at a doctor’s clinic in Vaishali district, the Opposition in Bihar on Saturday expressed serious concern over the “deteriorating law and order situation” in the State.

With the rising incidents of crime, the Opposition leaders have slammed the State government. “The situation has become worse than 2005 when the RJD was in power … every day someone somewhere is being killed ... the government has failed in maintaining law and order,” said Lok Janshakti Party leader Pashupati Kumar Paras.

In Delhi, the party chief and Union Minister Ram Vilas Paswan too cornered the government for the rising incidents of crime. Mr. Paswan will visit Hajipur on Sunday to take stock of the situation. “Why is the Chief Minister so helpless and silent on all this,” asked Mr. Paswan, an MP from Hajipur.

“Earlier, it was businessmen, doctors but now even the policemen and MLAs are becoming targets of criminals,” said former Chief Minister and leader of Hindustani Awam Morcha (Secular) Jitan Ram Manjhi.

Senior BJP leader Prem Kumar targeted the government saying “Jungle Raj-2 has actually descended on Bihar.”
title: Chief Minister helpless and silent: Paswan
